revised_title: Whale Hunting Techniques in the Bermuda Islands
tldr: In the 17th century, sea explorers in the Bermuda Islands discovered new techniques for hunting whales. They managed to kill two adult female whales and three young ones during their expeditions. The author describes the physical characteristics of these whales, their speed, and their feeding habits. He also mentions the oil extracted from their blubber, which has healing properties and can be used for various purposes. The whales are believed to retire to the Gulf of Florida during the summer months.
